task.title: Southwest Breakfast Wraps
task.shortdesc: These wraps are portable and easy to share. Enjoy them while reading the morning paper, getting ready for work, or over the breakfast table with loved ones. Packed with a variety of ingredients, these wraps are customizable and fun to make.

taskbody.prereq:
Tools for this recipe include a colander, a mixing bowl, measuring spoons a vegetable grater, spatula and skillet. The following ingredients will be needed:
4 slices of deli turkey breast
2 tablespoons grated cheddar cheese
1/4 cup diced tofu, drained and diced
1 russet potato, washed and grated through large holes of vegetable grater
1 small yellow onion, chopped finely
2 large corn tortillas
2 tablespoons of store-bought salsa
1/4 cup of canned black beans, washed and drained
2 teaspoons vegetable oil
1 teaspoon salt

step.cmd: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet on medium-high heat
In a mixing bowl, toss together the grated potatoes, chopped yellow onion, minced garlic, salsa, black beans, salt and pepper
In a mixing bowl, toss together the grated potatoes, chopped yellow onion, minced garlic, salsa, black beans, tofu, salt and pepper.
Add the mixture to the heated pan and cook for 15 minutes over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally.
Turn the heat off the pan and allow the mixture to cool
Layer slices of deli turkey on to a flat corn tortilla and sprinkle cheddar cheese over the turkey
Spoon the cooled potato mixture on to the center of the tortilla
Fold the left end of the tortilla towards the center and then fold the right end over
Roll the bottom (the end nearest you) up towards the top and continue rolling until sealed

taskbody.result: You will be left with a warm and filling wrap that can be taken anywhere your day goes.
taskbody.postreq: This recipe makes two servings. Extra wraps can be stored with aluminum foil for snacking later
